alert.note: Alert for Columbus; Inland Brunswick (North Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Wilmington (Northeastern South Carolina and Southeastern North Carolina - Wilmington)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 04 at 3:53PM EDT by NWS Wilmington
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of central Brunswick and east central Columbus Counties through 430 PM EDT... At 352 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Honey Island, or 11 miles north of Shallotte, moving east, southeast at 20 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Mill Creek, Makatoka, Town Creek, Honey Island, Supply, Brunswick County Community College Main Campus, Winnabow, Bolivia and Brunswick Novant Medical Center. This includes US Route 17 in Brunswick County between mile markers 21 and 38. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
